qas.question: How many police officers did the pro-independence FLN kill in August of 1961?
What was the result of the police officer killing?
How many people were killed during the demonstrations against the curfew?
Who carried out bombings throughout Paris between 1961 and 1962?

context: In the 1950s and the 1960s, Paris became one front of the Algerian War for independence; in August 1961, the pro-independence FLN targeted and killed <a0_0>11<a0_0/> Paris policemen, leading to the imposition of a <a1_0>curfew on Muslims of Algeria<a1_0/> (who, at that time, were French citizens). On 17 October 1961, an unauthorised but peaceful protest demonstration of Algerians against the curfew led to violent confrontations between the police and demonstrators, in which <a2_0>at least 40<a2_0/> people were killed, including some thrown into the Seine. The anti-independence <a3_0>Organisation de l'armée secrète<a3_0/> (OAS), for their part, carried out a series of bombings in Paris throughout 1961 and 1962.
